meanings.definition: A person who deserts one party or cause in order to join an opposing one.
meanings.sent1: The turncoat betrayed his friends by joining the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The spy was revealed to be a turncoat when he switched sides.
meanings.sent3: The turncoat's sudden change of heart left everyone shocked.
meanings.sent4: The politician was labeled a turncoat after his surprising decision.
meanings.sent5: The turncoat's actions were seen as disloyal and deceitful.

meanings.definition: To change one's allegiance or loyalty from one party or cause to another.
meanings.sent1: She decided to turncoat and support a different candidate.
meanings.sent2: The soldier was accused of planning to turncoat during the battle.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to turncoat on its favorite toy, choosing a new one.
meanings.sent4: The weather can quickly turncoat from sunny to stormy.
meanings.sent5: He had to turncoat his plans when unexpected guests arrived.
